ponto-caspia species: A group of aquatic invertebrates that have historically inhabited a specific region of eastern Europe and have adapted to thrive in a variety of water bodies, from natural rivers to artificial reservoirs and cooling ponds, often characterized by their ability to coexist and outcompete native species.
